title: firefox' background operations  9 operations running  all necessary
content: task manager has 9 operations running, trying to eliminate possiblities before last alternative turn to microsoftopoly, set to firefox recommendations everytime i need the speed or 100% of wide band frequency something is running in background, hard drive wont shutdown. I used to be able to gain some by restart. Doesn't seem to have same effect as used to, then I wud have to disconnect internet just to shutdown or it wud take a very long time, so that was my go to; disconnect internet, I feel that i shud not have to go to such extremes to use MY computer, now even that doesn't solve problem for very long, way back when , hard drive wud shut down after i stopped type idle minute or so, now i'm not sure it ever stops unless i disconnect internet then it will, this tells me something in background is running , wont shut off, when i start typing, so i just want to eliminate microjunk telling me its firefox' operation and i shud uninstall it and use EDGE. wud a VPN possibly eliminate if a program was using internet to communicate to whoever? if possible, does firefox have like 30 day trial period for access to VPN? Wud that even stop activity it's a microsoft product running? sending screenshots of task managers operations running at this point 3 sceens open, SmartNews; *Settings; Get Support / Mozilla Support...acting up just now, moment i stop clicking for few seconds, response is delayed couple seconds, I use onscreen keyboard to converse, clicking single letter at a time, also use HDMI into large screen monitor, thanx for all firefox' help you do make a difference . i greatly appreciate speed and knowledge you & firefox has done for accessibility to internet . taking to long to upload second page , i will cancel second pg, and other nine. i'm unable to stop or cancel upload image, started upload at 12:25pm , i do NOT want to reclick this whole message again, this is part of frustration i feel when tech ppl get something wrong, since i have no education in writing code, i'm basically helpless, how long to wait now.. .... .......... .....................try to send/submit, hope that works.

title: account not active ... contact administrator
content: I have loved being a Mozilla-stuff user intermittently since teaching on Netscape 1.1, and now am making Firefox 98.02 my default browser. I like both Safari and Firefox, and sometimes use them simultaneously for two accounts on the same service (not right now). My physically pristine 2015 Mac cannot install OS's past the 10.12 I have, so Safari is failing. But I am exasperated at runarounds when trying to set up this Firefox account. I used the emailed verification code and seemed to get in, but got the red-box message "This account... administrator... error." I cannot tell whether the site is letting me use it normally, but I think not. I just spent an hour in help forums. Geesh, tech complexity has mushroomed since my LAN work in the 90s, and you volunteers get to cope with inarticulate queries like mine! Upload is failing of jpg screen shot that has been made anonymous. Help?

title: Speedtest.net and other speedtest sites behaving weird in Firefox only.
content:
I was trying to do a speedtest in FireFox and on speedtest.net, the font is wrong, when I do the download it stutters and lags before it gets to the final result. For example I have 350-400 down usually. speedtest.net for the download test will skyrocket and stutter to 330+, then stutter and skyrocket down to 120+ then to 200+ and then it will just end.

Other speedtest sites such as Speakeasy.net and Fast.com are hit or miss if they will show an upload speed. Sometimes they show the upload 0, sometimes it works like it seems its supposed to.

In Chrome and on my phone the tests all work just fine. Firefox seems to be having issues and I was curious if anyone else is experiencing these things or could shed some light. I have had problems with Speedtest.net on Firefox in the past but back then it was straight up crashes, not what is happening now.

I am on the latest Firefox version and I am unsure as to how long this problem may have been occurring because I haven't tried doing a speed test in quite some time.

Thank you.

Thanks!

title: WEBSITE FEATURES NO LONGER WORKING (BUT STILL DO WITH MS EDGE!!)
content:
Hi,

My wife & I have used Firefox for some considerable time now and like it a lot.

However, we have been having trouble with Firefox recently and wonder if you are aware of this. It manifests itself in a very subtle way with only some FEATURES of a particular website not operating, (but no ‘warning’ messages whatsoever).

To begin with, I was at a loss to understand why something didn’t work but, now that this has happened to me on THREE different websites (with features that work perfectly well under MS Edge!), I have come to the conclusion that Firefox is the only “common denominator”.

The first problem was with https://www.parcel2go.com. They have a “Live Help” (Chat) feature. It no longer works with Firefox!

The second was with https://account.patientaccess.com. Try to order “repeat prescriptions” and all is well – until you hit “send”. It no longer works with Firefox!

Today, I have discovered that with https://www.bt.com I am now longer able to access my BT email accounts. Furthermore, they also have a “chat” facility – except that is now also ‘invisible’ to Firefox!

I have seen mention that DuckDuckGo (which I also use) might be involved here?

What’s happened?!!

creator: vatch23

title: Automatical update destroys my work
content:
Firefox updates automatically at random points in time and destroys all the work as I cannot open any new tab(every new tab says something about restarting Firefox). This causes severe problems as some people may use Firefox for work and it may be quite a f__k up when you're discussing something with your client and out of a sudden you need to tell them that all you've been building up for the last 20minutes needs to be done again and you're short of time because the meeting ends in, let's say, 10 minutes.

That means Firefox is not useful for professional use like business, science(reported by someone else https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1314749 ) and probably other fields.

How about telling the user that Firefox is going to update when restarted but not forcing the user to restart it NOW and to destroy user's work at random points in time?

Besides the above Firefox dosen't restore the tabs when forcefully quits to do the update which not only makes me lose the content of a form that was being filled but also varius tabs that were opened at that time.

I'm aware that I can disable automatic updates by setting one of the parameters to false in about:config but I'm not sure whether I'll be informed about updates in this case and what's more this doesn't make Firefox suitable for a regular user that may not have this knowledge. Chrome is more friendly to regular users in this case.

The issue happend: when upgrading to Firefox 98.0.2 (64bit) and a few earlier versions in Ubuntu 20.04 LTS

creator: ulrich40

title: Downloads Drop-Down menu mystery and Zoom glitch
content:
I think I may have a ghost in my desktop. 2 events happen with firefox that have followed from a previous pc build. At seemingly random times if Firefox is open and the visible tab has text, as in is not a full tab video stream, all of the text and images will shrink in size and spacing. This is independent of the zoom function as it remains at 100. Zooming to make text larger again looks weird and bulky, refreshing the page however will restore it. This glitch happens even if another application has focus, even if it is fullscreen exclusive. I haven't been able to figure out what kind of shortcut, command, or addon might possibly be able to do this.

The drop-down mystery happens when the visible tab is a full tab stream. Again even if another application has focus, the download drop-down appears and stays until I click somewhere. I've only seen it appear once and it does not look like when I choose to click the drop-down button. The size of the drop-down changed a couple to several times, and I believe the first download item appeared to be highlighted in dark blue, something I can't reproduce with my mouse or keyboard, it only highlights a different color grey. This one makes me nervous as it could possibly be something activating a download and then immediately deleting it from history? I only just recently learned the the menu will appear automatically when downloading something.

I've tried reinstalling Firefox. I don't notice this on edge, though I only have to use it a fraction of the time. I've never noticed any extra commands or text appear that I didn't type or direct in other applications. This somehow shows up after a fresh windows 10 install, and have since replaced keyboard & mouse. I've tried leaving a keylogger over long periods and it never shows anything. I refuse to leave Mozilla, any help is greatly appreciated. Thank you for reading this far :)
creator: GentlerGiant

title: Print dialog - It aint broke, so don't fix it. Bring back option for the default to system print dialog
content:
Please bring back the option to let the system print dialog be the default. There's no need to fix what's not broken. I dislike the new FireFox dialog. I like and am used to the system print dialog, it works, does what I want, and it should be brought back for consistency with other applications.

I could previously fix this in about:config, but that option is now ignored.

I understand the desire to try something new, but it makes no sense to improve on what already works. And, to remove the about:config option means your imposing your will on me. FireFox never felt like an imposition before, this is like something I'd expect from Apple, not Mozilla.

Please bring back my choice and make it an easy configuration checkbox, no about:config voodoo.

Thanks!
creator: DavidOrDave
